snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry, angry with the United Nations’ failure to aid Syrian war victims, said the United States may step up aid without Syria’s consent.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry says the United States is considering ways to increase the delivery of aid to war victims in Syria without the consent of Pres Bashar al-Assad's government; Kerry's pledge directly challenges United Nations policy to deliver aid only with government consent.

byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry, angry with the United Nations’ failure to aid Syrian war victims, said the United States may step up aid without Syria’s consent.

headline.main: U.S. Seeks to Bypass Assad So More Aid Can Reach Syrian Civilians
headline.print_headline: U.S. Seeks to Bypass Assad So More Aid Can Reach Syrian Civilians
